description: Solutions for The Chicago Loop game levels. Each solution contains the initial 5x5 grid setup (true=alive, false=dead) and the rules for cell birth/survival.
usage: Load this file and use ChicagoLoopGame.simulate(levelIndex, setupGrid, rules) to verify solutions

levels.name: The Tunnels
levels.strategy: Place cells to the right and below the starting position to push player up-left. Use rules that create a persistent wave pattern.
levels.notes: The diagonal pattern creates a wave that persistently pushes the player toward the goal. Standard Conway rules work well here.

levels.name: The River
levels.strategy: Place cells to the left of starting position to push player right. Need a pattern that moves rightward or persists.
levels.notes: Block patterns (2x2) are stable in Conway's rules. Multiple blocks create consistent rightward pressure.

levels.name: The Streets
levels.strategy: Place cells to the right and above to push player left and down.
levels.notes: A filled square pattern creates oscillating behavior that pushes the player diagonally.

alternativeSolutions.description: Alternative rule sets that can work with different setups

highLife.notes: HighLife variant - cells also born with 6 neighbors. Creates more dynamic patterns.

dayAndNight.notes: Day & Night rules - symmetric pattern. Dead and alive cells behave similarly.

seeds.notes: Seeds - explosive growth, cells die immediately but reproduce first. Very chaotic.
